--- In rest-discuss@yahoogroups.com, Mike Kelly <mike@...> wrote:
>
> Are t=
here benefits of using custom versioned media types instead of 
> using a c=
ombination of standard media types and a custom version 
> header?

Well, t=
here is the fact that HTTP clients tend to have passable to good support fo=
r custom media types.  Not so much for a version header.  Further, a media =
type is a better way to distinguish between versions of an API because the =
representations are highly likely to have changed.
